blog.name: it-just-makes-sensee
blog.title: Be Your Own Damn Hero
blog.description: 26. I drink too much coffee and watch too many shows. My inbox is ALWAYS open, for anything and anyone.

summary: Wow Maisie Williams and Sophie Turner have both recently done long interviews where they talk about their struggle with mental...
body:
Wow Maisie Williams and Sophie Turner have both recently done long interviews where they talk about their struggle with mental health. I know a lot of people in the industry have opened up, but these two really dive deep into their struggles and it’s so eye opening, because we look at them and see two stunningly beautiful and talented people who both come off as bubbly, happy and hilarious.. but both have had truly deep depression/anxiety, and I know will truly touch a lot of people, especially young girls. I wonder all the time how much it could have helped me at the age of 15/16 seeing someone in the spotlight like them talking about such issues, it would have made me feel less alone, so I’m super proud of them for speaking out.

Also, a huge factor in both their mental health was negative comments/opinions from others, especially on social media, so for the love of god stop being fucking assholes to celebrities or ANYONE for no reason.

summary: If I’m not mistaken, Robb & Talisa, Jon & Ygritte, and Arya & Gendry are the only characters whose first times have been...
body: If I’m not mistaken, Robb & Talisa, Jon & Ygritte, and Arya & Gendry are the only characters whose first times have been consensual and with someone they chose to be with because they loved and trusted them. The sad thing is Robb and Jon ended up having to watch the women they love die and I pray to the Old Gods and the New that Arya won’t go through the same as her older brothers did and have to watch Gendry die.

tags: i mean at the end of the day masie williams is 22
it's wholly possible she's gonna be doing these scenes at times
summary: From what I can gather about the GoT thing is that most people feel kinda uncomfortable about the fact that the writers just had...
question: From what I can gather about the GoT thing is that most people feel kinda uncomfortable about the fact that the writers just had to have a sex scene for an actress they've known since being a kid, same as how they planned Sansa being raped by Ramsey for years and was just waiting for Sophie to come of age. So I kinda get feeling a bit squicked out? (Plus Joe said he felt awkward since he'd known her since she was like 11/12) I think it's more that than the scene itself tbh?
answer:
I mean, I’ve seen the scene now and far be it from me to say what people may or may not get squicked out by? *shrugs* That being said, I do find it telling that these kinds of scandalised furores only tend to erupt around female former-child-actors doing sex scenes, reminding us that young women having even a passing interest in sex is dangerous and dirty. I mean, contrast anything even remotely sexual Emma Watson ever did post-HP which was treated with a bizarre, vaguely salacious, won’t someone think of the children! emphasis by the press; whereas people were lining up around the block to see Dan Radcliffe in Equus because of course he’s going to be doing sexy scenes now, he’s a man and that means doing man things. (Not that sexualising young male actors isn’t also dangerous; these gendered attitudes towards sex are fun little two-edged swords that somehow manage to fuck both men and women over.)

I’ve also seen a lot of comments about Arya’s character being ‘ruined’ by incorporating romance and sex with a boy into her storyline, and equating her sex scene with that of Sansa’s rape scene with Ramsay, and I just don’t get that?? at all?? Like, protecting young woman from sexual assault by completely removing them from the whole concept of sex and romance is not how it works; it’s one of the most positive concepts I’ve seen presented on this benighted show: that a young woman can take control of her own sexuality and be a badass fighter who also gets love and sex with a man of her choosing. (also, arguably, that if it’s your first time and you don’t yet quite know what you want from your sexual experiences, find someone with whom you have a good and caring relationship who you know is going to treat you right.)

But at the end of the day it was a twenty second scene; to be perfectly honest, I doubt they’re going to have much more sexy funtimes in the near future with the entire cast of The Walking Dead about to descend on Winterfell.

tags: because I’ve been seeing this everywhere and are people really that clueluess to not get the intended meaning in this scene
summary: Tired: “omg arya’s face in the last shot was her so disappointed after having sex lmao she definitely regrets it” Wired: arya...
body:
Tired: “omg arya’s face in the last shot was her so disappointed after having sex lmao she definitely regrets it”

Wired: arya was clearly thinking about everything she has to lose now that there’s actual human meaning in her life again and she‘s coming to terms with reconnecting with her feelings + has the capacity to feel fear about losing everyone she loves after years of unresolved trauma and damage that she dealt with by using violence and cutting herself off from her emotions

title: Make It Rain
description:
by Allysanthe

A war breaks through the Five Families of the New York City Mafia. If you are a Stark, a Martell, a Tyrell, a Greyjoy or a Lannister, you are no longer safe in the streets of the city anymore. And just as Robb Stark takes his father’s place as the head of Starks, there is a rumor that Jon Snow is heading back home.
